abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes that rise of Uber and other ride-sharing apps has posed obstacle in decades-long goal of making transportation services in New York City accessible to those who use wheelchairs and motorized scooters; former Mayor Michael R Bloomberg promised in settlement of lawsuit to make half of taxicabs in city wheelchair-accessible, but Uber and other companies are not included in that mandate.
lead_paragraph: Ride-hailing apps operate outside many transportation regulations, making them exempt from New York City’s requirement that half of the yellow taxis be accessible to people in wheelchairs by 2020.

headline.main: Accessibility as Challenge in Age of Uber
headline.print_headline: Accessibility as Challenge in Age of Uber

snippet: Ride-hailing apps operate outside many transportation regulations, making them exempt from New York City’s requirement that half of the yellow taxis be accessible to people in wheelchairs by 2020.
